WRITING.TITLE: WIBTA if I didn't want to go on holiday with my family?
WRITING.TEXT: Hi everyone. This is an issue that I am having a really hard time deciding on, hope you can help me clear it up. I am studying in my senior year of high school and my family want to go on holiday this Christmas to spend some time together. My brother is boarding overseas and my parents feel that this will be a chance for us to spend time together before I leave home for college. However, I don't really want to go for a couple reasons. Firstly, this will be one of the last opportunities I have to spend with my friends and girlfriend here, and I'm not sure if I will keep in touch or see many of these people again. I feel that my family has plenty of opportunity to spend time together because my brother comes home regularly for holidays and it's not like I will be leaving home forever once I go to university. I also feel that it's not necessary for us to go off to a foreign country to spend time together, and we could just spend time together enjoying Christmas and the new year as a family at home. I feel that if we were to leave I would miss out on one of my last opportunities to spend time with my friends and girlfriend. I have been thinking about whether or not I should confront my parents about this because they have to book the trip pretty soon and once it's done I will have to go for sure. WIBTA if I told them I don't want to go on a long trip at Christmas?
My break is about 2 weeks and they want to go to Europe which would mean at least a 10 day trip with a huge time diff.

My parents have always taken my opinion into account when it comes to this stuff but I feel kind of guilty for not going on holiday with them. I am sure that if I brought it up I wouldn't be forced to go on holiday but I didn't know if that would make me TA.
Thanks man I will try and convey that to them when I work up the courage to talk about it.

It's not like the Hong Kong protesters are completely innocent either. I'm not supporting the horrific actions by the government and police but at some points the actions of the protesters were shocking. I find that a lot of media paints them as innocent and peaceful and I just want to note that both sides have committed some pretty brutal and violent acts.
How is this a murder?

To be fair it wasn't a Chinese directive to make the extradition bill, or the Chinese government who are currently beating and hurting us. It's mostly an issue within the Hong Kong government and their inability to communicate with the protesters.

Yes they are being prevented from withdrawing the bill but I think that if Carrie lam has the ability to tell the public that the bill is "dead", the issue about withdrawal is merely an issue of semantics.

There's also an issue that the Chinese government won't let Carrie lam approve all 5 of the main requests. Understandably the independent inquiry for the police brutality is necessary and should be approved, but other things such as amnesty for protesters and the definition of rioters in the press cannot be approved by the government. I personally believe that the protesters who truly are violent and riot (like the ones who beat Chinese reporters at the airport) should not be given amnesty for their actions, and should serve jail time for what they did.

That is what semantics is. It's just a technicality, and now the focus of the protests isn't the bill anymore. I think if we are to have clear communication with the government, both sides need to compromise their demands

That is fair, but I also believe that Carrie lam is probably unable to withdraw the bill fully. The Chinese government would never allow her to do so because that would be an act of weakness which they cannot afford to show right now.
Oyster sauce and butter work really well together on rice.

WRITING.TITLE: Leaving the girl with the tab unpaid because she won't have sex with him.

WRITING.TEXT: Sorry I just thought this was very typical thing of a nice guy to do

Well depends on the context here. In Hong Kong we have 2 main groups that are fighting for our freedoms against the government, one is peaceful and one is really extremist. This guy is part of the latter group, and they are really violent and aggressive and even beat civilians if they have different ideologies from them.

Thanks! I see a lot of people on Reddit thinking the protesters are always super peaceful and heroes but the truth is a lot of them aren't as good as the media shows. There have been many cases where the protesters attack the civilians and gang up and beat random people.

Even if you were making an argument for why their violence is justified you cannot tell me that it is justified for a mob of protesters to beat a man into critical condition because he didn't agree with them. They're not fighting against the government, they're fighting against anyone who doesn't agree with them.

WRITING.TITLE: What was the story of your first love?

WRITING.TEXT: Yup it's a typical nice guy fantasy
I like how he assumes that if good looking people can cheat then they won't be loyal at all
You should try out sekiro if you like this kind of stuff.

Being a Hong Kong citizen it's really sad to see police beating protesters like this. But we also have to be sure to not become like them. I've seen too many people being beaten up by radical protesters because they don't agree with them. Keep up the protests peacefully, #21152; #27833; #65281;

I believe that it is possible but both sides need to stop acting out in violence. One thing I have noticed is that while the police often act violently and attack protesters, it is usually both sides that are using violence. I am a very strong advocate for peaceful protest because I feel like the current movement is far too violent towards anyone who opposes them. I believe that if the protesters use peaceful and respectful means to voice their issues, then de-escalation will help solve the issue. Right now we have the police beating protesters, but we also have protesters who beat anyone who doesn't agree with them, even old people and women. They also have doxxed many people who don't agree with them and mobbed their workplaces. In my opinion this makes them just as bad as the communist party police because they only want freedom for those who agree with them.

I don't think it is an issue of the mainland which is contrary to the agenda that a lot of media pushes. The mainland doesn't really have a stake in this issue, and has actually been taking steps to help dissolve the conflict. Right now, I think that the issue lies with the violent protesters, who I feel are wrong. Not all protesters are violent and many actually find peaceful ways to demonstrate, but the radical ones are out of control and continue to push this level of violence. They are on par with terrorists at this point because not only do they attack police and the government, but they also attack the civilians and citizens of Hong Kong. I believe that if they de-escalate the violence and everyone compromises and works together then this issue can be solved.

To a certain extent I believe that it did have an effect. The bill was suspended after 2 million of us took to the streets. I'd like to think that the results came because of the mass protests that makes me proud of Hong Kong. I don't believe that acting like terrorists can achieve the results that Hong Kong wants. And even if it does, the cost of compromising our own values and becoming like the CCP police isn't worth it.
I don't advocate for violence and beating up civilians so I must be paid to say this!

WRITING.TITLE: Radical protesters beat up a 70 year old civilian. He passed away today.

WRITING.TEXT: My opinion exactly. I am a Hong Konger and I believe in all the freedoms that they claim to be fighting for. But this isn't freedom or protest this is terrorism and it is pure degeneracy.
Are you seriously suggesting that I'm a Chinese shill just because I think it's terrible that they beat a 70 year old man up with rods...

I don't think he attacked first. Not physically at least. He's swearing at them because they hit him beforehand which is why I think he's bleeding on his head before the figjt starts. He was yelling at them to leave him alone and swearing and was beaten up when he stormed off.
I haven't but I just judged from his bleeding head. Doubt that happened on its own.

I'm not condoning any of the acts of the police, in fact I hate the fact I am afraid to wear black because police might search me for that. But I also believe that the protesters shouldn't be attacking civilians and I believe that this isn't reasonable. I've seen a lot of protesters who choose to be peaceful and chill together to demonstrate and I think that's the right way to show the government and the world how you feel.
For thinking that beating up a 70 year old is not ok? In what world is this considered ethical... How does being a decent human being make me a Chinese sympathiser?
How is this pro Chinese propaganda... Do you believe that acting this way is ethical or correct? How does my calling out of violent and unruly behaviour make it a Chinese propaganda piece?

Mhm mhm fascism is characterized by acts of oppression such as violent oppression of any opposite ideologies. Surely someone like yourself who sides with people who beat up the opposition can't possibly fall under that category.

I don't think it's necessary to decry them. Literally anyone with a brain can easily see that shit is terrible. But you can't act like this crap is justified and everything is black and white. I'm trying to show that the issue isn't just as simple as people like you make it out to be. "The police mistreat us so we can just fucking beat up random old people" nice fascism buddy.

So then by your logic your choice of not discussing this issue and instead using a red herring fallacy to justify this violence then shows that you actually condone this violence and beatings? As you said, because I don't make posts condemning the government and police then I am supporting their oppression, so therefore you are doing the same for this kind of violence?

I literally live in Hong Kong and have seen the police violence first had. The issue I'm trying to address is that everyone here on Reddit only sees this issue as black and white and sees the protesters as some heroes. I'm just trying to show the reality of the situation. Everyone knows about the police violence and crappy government it's literally China who doesn't know about that shit. I'm trying to show that the protesters aren't just some group of freedom fighting heroes, especially when they act like this.
I don't.
Yea and isshin at the end was crazy.
I really like the deflection system imo it's better than the rolling in DS and Bloodborne games because it's more precise and feels so much more smooth.

I agree but I also feel like the policeman was doing his job, and any armed policeman or woman from a democratic country would have done the same thing as he did.
I tried all these things but it's still not really great
Yea maybe. I'm running on an Alienware 17 which in theory should be ok but who knows.
They're not occasional

WRITING.TITLE: Old NDS Card Battle Game
WRITING.TEXT: I recently remember playing this game but I can't seem to remember what it was and I really want to try find it again. Platform(s): I remember playing this game on the NDS. Genre: Card battle/RPG. Estimated year of release: Unknown but I played it on the first NDS about 8-9 years ago. Graphics/art style: Remember it was a 3D graphic game and it involved a lot of animations where the character would summon things to fight for it through cards. Notable characters: I believe you played as some kind of small yellow chicken. Notable game mechanics: You would walk around like a kind of rpg and go through different levels but combat was based on summoning cards to fight for you. Other Details: Remember that there was a level in a kind of cave sort of place, and one in an underwater temple looking area. #8203; Hopefully someone knows what it is and can help me find it agian.

WRITING.TITLE: Geralt of Rivia VS Sekiro from Shadows Die Twice
WRITING.TEXT: Geralt and Sekiro run into each other and decide to fight to see who's the better swordsman. Round 1: Geralt has no potions or signs, Sekiro can't use any prosthetics or combat arts, both are just relying on their skills with the sword alone. Round 2: Geralt can use potions before the fight, Sekiro has access to all his prosthetic tools. Round 3: Geralt has all his signs and potions, Sekiro can use all prosthetics and combat arts. Who would come out as the better fighter in the end?
I was thinking that in round one sekiro may have the edge because he's used to fighting people who are a lot stronger than him and generally seems to be a bit better with the sword than geralt.

You need level three if you want to trade well with other people. Against strong early champs like talon and champs that have better range than you level 3 is generally when you can try for short burst trades with grass element. When you're level 6 you can use ice and ult to kill most squishy mage champions from almost full health.
Satire
